Setting Up Multiple Locks for Branching

Multiple locking is designed for groups who maintain parallel development paths (branches). Multiple locks simplify the creation of branches. If multiple locks per revision is enabled, different users can lock the same revision.

To set up multiple locks for newly created archives:

  1. Select the project database or project for which you are setting up multiple locking. All of the archives in the project database or project will allow multiple locking.

  2. Select Admin | Configure Project. The Configure Project dialog box appears with the General tab active.

  3. If not already selected, select the Show Advanced Options check box.

  4. In the Options list, select Locking beneath Archives. The Archive Locking pane on the right appears.

  5. Do one or both of the following:

    1. Select More Than One in the Locks Allowed on Each Revision group to allow multiple locks for each revision.

    2. Select More Than One in the Locks Allowed by Each User group to allow individual users to lock more than one revision of an archive at a time.

  6. Click OK.
